content:
Here is a series of maps that show the concentration of galaxies at certain distances away from Earth. Each map can be thought of as a view back to a particular time in the history of the Universeâ€”at greater distances we see the Universe as it was at earlier times.

Use the tool below to explore how the Universe has changed over time. Explore each map in all directions.

question.title: Question #1
question.label: Look at the map of the farthest distance. Does this map represent a time long ago (early in the Universe) or a recent time (later in the history of the Universe)?

question.title: Question #1
question.label: Look at the map of the closest distance. Does this map represent a time long ago (early in the Universe) or a recent time (later in the history of the Universe)?

question.title: Question #1
question.label: Describe how the distribution of galaxies in the Universe has changed over time. When were large numbers of galaxies clumped together (more concentrated) in some places? When were galaxies distributed more evenly?
